de.mrapp.android.tabswitcher.model

Interface Model

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<Tab>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    TabSwitcher, TabSwitcherModel

    public interface Model
extends java.lang.Iterable<Tab>
    Defines the interface, a class, which implements the model of a TabSwitcher must implement.
    Since:
    0.1.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Model.Listener
      Defines the interface, a class, which should be notified about the model's events, must implement.

        @NonNull
android.content.Context getContext()
        Returns the context, which is used by the tab switcher.

        The context, which is used by the tab switcher, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null

                  TabSwitcherDecorator decorator)
        Sets the decorator, which allows to inflate the views, which correspond to the tabs of the tab switcher.
        Parameters:
        decorator - The decorator, which should be set, as an instance of the class TabSwitcherDecorator. The decorator may not be null

        Returns the decorator, which allows to inflate the views, which correspond to the tabs of the tab switcher.
        Returns:
        The decorator as an instance of the class TabSwitcherDecorator or null, if no decorator has been set

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Returns, whether the tab switcher is empty, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if the tab switcher is empty, false otherwise

      • getCount

        int getCount()
        Returns the number of tabs, which are contained by the tab switcher.
        Returns:
        The number of tabs, which are contained by the tab switcher, as an Integer value

      • getTab

        @NonNull
Tab getTab(int index)
        Returns the tab at a specific index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the tab, which should be returned, as an Integer value. The index must be at least 0 and at maximum getCount() - 1, otherwise a IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The tab, which corresponds to the given index, as an instance of the class Tab. The tab may not be null

      • indexOf

        int indexOf(@NonNull
            Tab tab)
        Returns the index of a specific tab.
        Parameters:
        tab - The tab, whose index should be returned, as an instance of the class Tab. The tab may not be null
        Returns:
        The index of the given tab as an Integer value or -1, if the given tab is not contained by the tab switcher

      • addTab

        void addTab(@NonNull
            Tab tab)
        Adds a new tab to the tab switcher. By default, the tab is added at the end. If the switcher is currently shown, the tab is added by using an animation. By default, a SwipeAnimation with direction SwipeAnimation.SwipeDirection.RIGHT is used. If an animation is currently running, the tab will be added once all previously started animations have been finished.
        Parameters:
        tab - The tab, which should be added, as an instance of the class Tab. The tab may not be null

      • addTab

        void addTab(@NonNull
            Tab tab,
            int index)
        Adds a new tab to the tab switcher at a specific index. If the switcher is currently shown, the tab is added by using an animation. By default, a SwipeAnimation with direction SwipeAnimation.SwipeDirection.RIGHT is used. If an animation is currently running, the tab will be added once all previously started animations have been finished.
        Parameters:
        tab - The tab, which should be added, as an instance of the class Tab. The tab may not be null
        index - The index, the tab should be added at, as an Integer value. The index must be at least 0 and at maximum getCount(), otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown

      • addTab

        void addTab(@NonNull
            Tab tab,
            int index,
            @NonNull
            Animation animation)
        Adds a new tab to the tab switcher at a specific index. If the switcher is currently shown, the tab is added by using a specific animation. If an animation is currently running, the tab will be added once all previously started animations have been finished.
        Parameters:
        tab - The tab, which should be added, as an instance of the class Tab. The tab may not be null
        index - The index, the tab should be added at, as an Integer value. The index must be at least 0 and at maximum getCount(), otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        animation - The animation, which should be used to add the tab, as an instance of the class Animation. The animation may not be null

      • addAllTabs

        void addAllTabs(@NonNull
                java.util.Collection<? extends Tab> tabs)
        Adds all tabs, which are contained by a collection, to the tab switcher. By default, the tabs are added at the end. If the switcher is currently shown, the tabs are added by using an animation. By default, a SwipeAnimation with direction SwipeAnimation.SwipeDirection.RIGHT is used. If an animation is currently running, the tabs will be added once all previously started animations have been finished.
        Parameters:
        tabs - A collection, which contains the tabs, which should be added, as an instance of the type Collection or an empty collection, if no tabs should be added

      • addAllTabs

        void addAllTabs(@NonNull
                java.util.Collection<? extends Tab> tabs,
                int index)
        Adds all tabs, which are contained by a collection, to the tab switcher, starting at a specific index. If the switcher is currently shown, the tabs are added by using an animation. By default, a SwipeAnimation with direction SwipeAnimation.SwipeDirection.RIGHT is used. If an animation is currently running, the tabs will be added once all previously started animations have been finished.
        Parameters:
        tabs - A collection, which contains the tabs, which should be added, as an instance of the type Collection or an empty collection, if no tabs should be added
        index - The index, the first tab should be started at, as an Integer value. The index must be at least 0 and at maximum getCount(), otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown

      • addAllTabs

        void addAllTabs(@NonNull
                java.util.Collection<? extends Tab> tabs,
                int index,
                @NonNull
                Animation animation)
        Adds all tabs, which are contained by a collection, to the tab switcher, starting at a specific index. If the switcher is currently shown, the tabs are added by using a specific animation. If an animation is currently running, the tabs will be added once all previously started animations have been finished.
        Parameters:
        tabs - A collection, which contains the tabs, which should be added, as an instance of the type Collection or an empty collection, if no tabs should be added
        index - The index, the first tab should be started at, as an Integer value. The index must be at least 0 and at maximum getCount(), otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        animation - The animation, which should be used to add the tabs, as an instance of the class Animation. The animation may not be null

      • addAllTabs

        void addAllTabs(@NonNull
                Tab[] tabs)
        Adds all tabs, which are contained by an array, to the tab switcher. By default, the tabs are added at the end. If the switcher is currently shown, the tabs are added by using an animation. By default, a SwipeAnimation with direction SwipeAnimation.SwipeDirection.RIGHT is used. If an animation is currently running, the tabs will be added once all previously started animations have been finished.
        Parameters:
        tabs - An array, which contains the tabs, which should be added, as an array of the type Tab or an empty array, if no tabs should be added

      • addAllTabs

        void addAllTabs(@NonNull
                Tab[] tabs,
                int index)
        Adds all tabs, which are contained by an array, to the tab switcher, starting at a specific index. If the switcher is currently shown, the tabs are added by using an animation. By default, a SwipeAnimation with direction SwipeAnimation.SwipeDirection.RIGHT is used. If an animation is currently running, the tabs will be added once all previously started animations have been finished.
        Parameters:
        tabs - An array, which contains the tabs, which should be added, as an array of the type Tab or an empty array, if no tabs should be added
        index - The index, the first tab should be started at, as an Integer value. The index must be at least 0 and at maximum getCount(), otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown

      • addAllTabs

        void addAllTabs(@NonNull
                Tab[] tabs,
                int index,
                @NonNull
                Animation animation)
        Adds all tabs, which are contained by an array, to the tab switcher, starting at a specific index. If the switcher is currently shown, the tabs are added by using a specific animation. If an animation is currently running, the tabs will be added once all previously started animations have been finished.
        Parameters:
        tabs - An array, which contains the tabs, which should be added, as an array of the type Tab or an empty array, if no tabs should be added
        index - The index, the first tab should be started at, as an Integer value. The index must be at least 0 and at maximum getCount(), otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        animation - The animation, which should be used to add the tabs, as an instance of the class Animation. The animation may not be null

      • removeTab

        void removeTab(@NonNull
               Tab tab)
        Removes a specific tab from the tab switcher. If the switcher is currently shown, the tab is removed by using an animation. By default, a SwipeAnimation with direction SwipeAnimation.SwipeDirection.RIGHT is used. If an animation is currently running, the tab will be removed once all previously started animations have been finished.
        Parameters:
        tab - The tab, which should be removed, as an instance of the class Tab. The tab may not be null

      • removeTab

        void removeTab(@NonNull
               Tab tab,
               @NonNull
               Animation animation)
        Removes a specific tab from the tab switcher. If the switcher is currently shown, the tab is removed by using a specific animation. If an animation is currently running, the tab will be removed once all previously started animations have been finished.
        Parameters:
        tab - The tab, which should be removed, as an instance of the class Tab. The tab may not be null
        animation - The animation, which should be used to remove the tabs, as an instance of the class Animation. The animation may not be null

      • clear

        void clear()
        Removes all tabs from the tab switcher. If the switcher is currently shown, the tabs are removed by using an animation. By default, a SwipeAnimation with direction SwipeAnimation.SwipeDirection.RIGHT is used. If an animation is currently running, the tabs will be removed once all previously started animations have been finished.

      • clear

        void clear(@NonNull
           Animation animation)
        Removes all tabs from the tab switcher. If the switcher is currently shown, the tabs are removed by using a specific animation. If an animation is currently running, the tabs will be removed once all previously started animations have been finished.
        Parameters:
        animation - The animation, which should be used to remove the tabs, as an instance of the class Animation. The animation may not be null

      • isSwitcherShown

        boolean isSwitcherShown()
        Returns, whether the tab switcher is currently shown.
        Returns:
        True, if the tab switcher is currently shown, false otherwise

      • showSwitcher

        void showSwitcher()
        Shows the tab switcher by using an animation, if it is not already shown.

      • hideSwitcher

        void hideSwitcher()
        Hides the tab switcher by using an animation, if it is currently shown.

      • toggleSwitcherVisibility

        void toggleSwitcherVisibility()
        Toggles the visibility of the tab switcher by using an animation, i.e. if the switcher is currently shown, it is hidden, otherwise it is shown.

      • getSelectedTab

        @Nullable
Tab getSelectedTab()
        Returns the currently selected tab.
        Returns:
        The currently selected tab as an instance of the class Tab or null, if no tab is currently selected

      • getSelectedTabIndex

        int getSelectedTabIndex()
        Returns the index of the currently selected tab.
        Returns:
        The index of the currently selected tab as an Integer value or -1, if no tab is currently selected

      • selectTab

        void selectTab(@NonNull
               Tab tab)
        Selects a specific tab.
        Parameters:
        tab - The tab, which should be selected, as an instance of the class Tab. The tab may not be null. If the tab is not contained by the tab switcher, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown

      • setPadding

        void setPadding(int left,
                int top,
                int right,
                int bottom)
        Sets the padding of the tab switcher.
        Parameters:
        left - The left padding, which should be set, in pixels as an Integer value
        top - The top padding, which should be set, in pixels as an Integer value
        right - The right padding, which should be set, in pixels as an Integer value
        bottom - The bottom padding, which should be set, in pixels as an Integer value

      • getPaddingLeft

        int getPaddingLeft()
        Returns the left padding of the tab switcher.
        Returns:
        The left padding of the tab switcher in pixels as an Integer value

      • getPaddingTop

        int getPaddingTop()
        Returns the top padding of the tab switcher.
        Returns:
        The top padding of the tab switcher in pixels as an Integer value

      • getPaddingRight

        int getPaddingRight()
        Returns the right padding of the tab switcher.
        Returns:
        The right padding of the tab switcher in pixels as an Integer value

      • getPaddingBottom

        int getPaddingBottom()
        Returns the bottom padding of the tab switcher.
        Returns:
        The bottom padding of the tab switcher in pixels as an Integer value

      • getPaddingStart

        int getPaddingStart()
        Returns the start padding of the tab switcher. This corresponds to the right padding, if a right-to-left layout is used, or to the left padding otherwise.
        Returns:
        The start padding of the tab switcher in pixels as an Integer value

      • getPaddingEnd

        int getPaddingEnd()
        Returns the end padding of the tab switcher. This corresponds ot the left padding, if a right-to-left layout is used, or to the right padding otherwise.
        Returns:
        The end padding of the tab switcher in pixels as an Integer value

        @Nullable
android.graphics.drawable.Drawable getTabIcon()
        Returns the default icon of a tab.
        Returns:
        The default icon of a tab as an instance of the class Drawable or null, if no icon is set

      • areToolbarsShown

        boolean areToolbarsShown()
        Returns, whether the toolbars are shown, when the tab switcher is shown, or not. When using the tablet layout, the toolbars are always shown.
        Returns:
        True, if the toolbars are shown, false otherwise

      • showToolbars

        void showToolbars(boolean show)
        Sets, whether the toolbars should be shown, when the tab switcher is shown, or not. This method does not have any effect when using the tablet layout.
        Parameters:
        show - True, if the toolbars should be shown, false otherwise

      • getToolbarTitle

        @Nullable
java.lang.CharSequence getToolbarTitle()
        Returns the title of the toolbar, which is shown, when the tab switcher is shown. When using the tablet layout, the title corresponds to the primary toolbar.
        Returns:
        The title of the toolbar, which is shown, when the tab switcher is shown, as an instance of the type CharSequence or null, if no title is set

      • setToolbarTitle

        void setToolbarTitle(@StringRes
                     int resourceId)
        Sets the title of the toolbar, which is shown, when the tab switcher is shown. When using the tablet layout, the title is set to the primary toolbar.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource id of the title, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid string resource

      • setToolbarTitle

        void setToolbarTitle(@Nullable
                     java.lang.CharSequence title)
        Sets the title of the toolbar, which is shown, when the tab switcher is shown. When using the tablet layout, the title is set to the primary toolbar.
        Parameters:
        title - The title, which should be set, as an instance of the type CharSequence or null, if no title should be set

      • getToolbarNavigationIcon

        @Nullable
android.graphics.drawable.Drawable getToolbarNavigationIcon()
        Returns the navigation icon of the toolbar, which is shown, when the tab switcher is shown. When using the tablet layout, the icon corresponds to the primary toolbar.
        Returns:
        The icon of the toolbar, which is shown, when the tab switcher is shown, as an instance of the class Drawable or null, if no icon is set

      • setToolbarNavigationIcon

        void setToolbarNavigationIcon(@DrawableRes
                              int resourceId,
                              @Nullable
                              android.view.View.OnClickListener listener)
        Sets the navigation icon of the toolbar, which is shown, when the tab switcher is shown. When using the tablet layout, the icon is set to the primary toolbar.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource id of the icon, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid drawable resource
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when the navigation item has been clicked, as an instance of the type View.OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setToolbarNavigationIcon

        void setToolbarNavigationIcon(@Nullable
                              android.graphics.drawable.Drawable icon,
                              @Nullable
                              android.view.View.OnClickListener listener)
        Sets the navigation icon of the toolbar, which is shown, when the tab switcher is shown. When using the tablet layout, the icon is set to the primary toolbar.
        Parameters:
        icon - The icon, which should be set, as an instance of the class Drawable or null, if no icon should be set
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when the navigation item has been clicked, as an instance of the type View.OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • inflateToolbarMenu

        void inflateToolbarMenu(@MenuRes
                        int resourceId,
                        @Nullable
                        android.support.v7.widget.Toolbar.OnMenuItemClickListener listener)
        Inflates the menu of the toolbar, which is shown, when the tab switcher is shown. When using the tablet layout, the menu is inflated into the secondary toolbar.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource id of the menu, which should be inflated, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid menu resource
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an menu item has been clicked, as an instance of the type OnMenuItemClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • addCloseTabListener

        void addCloseTabListener(@NonNull
                         TabCloseListener listener)
        Adds a new listener, which should be notified, when a tab is about to be closed by clicking its close button.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be added, as an instance of the type TabCloseListener. The listener may not be null

      • removeCloseTabListener

        void removeCloseTabListener(@NonNull
                            TabCloseListener listener)
        Removes a specific listener, which should not be notified, when a tab is about to be closed by clicking its close button, anymore.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be removed, as an instance of the type TabCloseListener. The listener may not be null

      • addTabPreviewListener

        void addTabPreviewListener(@NonNull
                           TabPreviewListener listener)
        Adds a new listener, which should be notified, when the preview of a tab is about to be loaded. Previews are only loaded when using the smartphone layout.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be added, as an instance of the type TabPreviewListener. The listener may not be null

      • removeTabPreviewListener

        void removeTabPreviewListener(@NonNull
                              TabPreviewListener listener)
        Removes a specific listener, which should not be notified, when the preview of a tab is about to be loaded.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be removed, as an instance of the type TabPreviewListener. The listener may not be null
